New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored a franchise-record 33 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, leading the Oklahoma City Thunder to a 15th consecutive win.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander recorded 33 points, 11 rebounds, and 6 assists, contributing significantly to the Thunder's victory.
The Oklahoma City Thunder set a franchise record with their 15th straight win, defeating the Boston Celtics 105-92 on January 5, 2025.
Key Match Events: The Oklahoma City Thunder extended their win streak to 15 with a dominant performance against the Boston Celtics.
The game was closely contested in the first half but the Thunder pulled away in the second half, securing their victory.
The Thunder's defensive efforts were pivotal, limiting the Celtics to 92 points and key defensive stops late in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Paycom Center in Oklahoma City, drawing 18,203 fans.
The Thunder's field goal percentage (44.8%) and three-point percentage (42.1%) were better than the Celtics' (36.5% and 19.6%).
